Token.Abstract: The AFMultipartFormData protocol defines the methods supported by the parameter in the block argument of AFHTTPClient -multipartFormRequestWithMethod:path:parameters:constructingBodyWithBlock:.

Appends the HTTP header Content-Disposition: file; filename=#{generated filename}; name=#{name}" and Content-Type: #{generated mimeType}, followed by the encoded file data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: fileURL
Parameter.Abstract: The URL corresponding to the file whose content will be appended to the form. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: If an error occurs, upon return contains an NSError object that describes the problem.

ReturnValue.Abstract:
YES if the file data was successfully appended, otherwise NO.
@discussion The filename and MIME type for this data in the form will be automatically generated, using NSURLResponse -suggestedFilename and -MIMEType, respectively.

Token.Abstract: Appends the HTTP header Content-Disposition: file; filename=#{filename}; name=#{name}" and Content-Type: #{mimeType}, followed by the encoded file data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: mimeType
Parameter.Abstract: The MIME type of the specified data. (For example, the MIME type for a JPEG image is image/jpeg.) For a list of valid MIME types, see http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: filename
Parameter.Abstract: The filename to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Appends the HTTP headers Content-Disposition: form-data; name=#{name}", followed by the encoded data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name to be associated with the specified data. This parameter must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Appends HTTP headers, followed by the encoded data and the multipart form boundary.

Parameter.Name: headers
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP headers to be appended to the form data.

Parameter.Name: body
Parameter.Abstract: The data to be encoded and appended to the form data.

Token.Abstract: Throttles request bandwidth by limiting the packet size and adding a delay for each chunk read from the upload stream.

Parameter.Name: numberOfBytes
Parameter.Abstract: Maximum packet size, in number of bytes. The default packet size for an input stream is 32kb.

Parameter.Name: delay
Parameter.Abstract:
Duration of delay each time a packet is read. By default, no delay is set.
@discussion When uploading over a 3G or EDGE connection, requests may fail with "request body stream exhausted". Setting a maximum packet size and delay according to the recommended values (kAFUploadStream3GSuggestedPacketSize and kAFUploadStream3GSuggestedDelay) lowers the risk of the input stream exceeding its allocated bandwidth. Unfortunately, as of iOS 6, there is no definite way to distinguish between a 3G, EDGE, or LTE connection. As such, it is not recommended that you throttle bandwidth based solely on network reachability. Instead, you should consider checking for the "request body stream exhausted" in a failure block, and then retrying the request with throttled bandwidth.
